ISSUE.TITLE: "Notify for qty below" setting in product details doesn't work
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: nopCommerce version: 4.1, 4.0 Problem: The "Notify for qty below" setting in product details doesn't work. It doesn't notify the store owner for stock quantities below the specified value. It only notifies the store owner when the stock quantity reaches number zero. What I've done to produce the problem: 1- Create a product of type simple. 2-In "Inventory method" setting choose "Track inventory". 3- Set "Stock quantity" to number 6 4- Set "Notify for qty below" to number 4 5- Then I reduce the quantity by buying the product (each time only one item is bought) 6- No notifications are displayed in dashboard in "Common statistics" section when the product quantity reaches number 4 or 3. 7- Continue buying the product, and you can see no notifications are displayed until product quantity is equal to zero. Edit: I found that "Notify for qty below" setting was completely ignored for filtering the related result set in source code and other values were used instead of it. So i made pull request #3356 to fix the issue.
